member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute
member.summary: Attribute used to indicate a source generator should create a function for marshalling arguments instead of relying on the runtime to generate an equivalent marshalling function at run-time.
member.remarks: This attribute is meaningless if the source generator associated with it is not enabled. The current built-in source generator only supports C# and only supplies an implementation when applied to static, partial, non-generic methods.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the .
member.param: Name of the library containing the import.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.LibraryName
member.summary: Gets the name of the library containing the import.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.EntryPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the entry point to be called.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshalling
member.summary: Gets or sets how to marshal string arguments to the method.
member.remarks: If this field is set to a value other than , must not be specified.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.StringMarshallingCustomType
member.summary: Gets or sets the used to control how string arguments to the method are marshalled.
member.remarks: If this field is specified, must not be specified or must be set to .

member.name: P:System.Runtime.InteropServices.LibraryImportAttribute.SetLastError
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the callee sets an error (SetLastError on Windows or errno on other platforms) before returning from the attributed method.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling
member.summary: Specifies how strings should be marshalled for generated p/invokes

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Custom
member.summary: Indicates the user is suppling a specific marshaller in .

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Utf8
member.summary: Use the platform-provided UTF-8 marshaller.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.InteropServices.StringMarshalling.Utf16
member.summary: Use the platform-provided UTF-16 marshaller.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.OSPlatformAttribute
member.summary: Base type for all platform-specific API attributes.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.TargetPlatformAttribute
member.summary: Records the platform that the project targeted.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.SupportedOSPlatformAttribute
member.summary: Records the operating system (and minimum version) that supports an API. Multiple attributes can be applied to indicate support on multiple operating systems.
member.remarks:
Callers can apply a or use guards to prevent calls to APIs on unsupported operating systems.
A given platform should only be specified once.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.UnsupportedOSPlatformAttribute
member.summary: Marks APIs that were removed in a given operating system version.
member.remarks: Primarily used by OS bindings to indicate APIs that are only available in earlier versions.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.ObsoletedOSPlatformAttribute
member.summary: Marks APIs that were obsoleted in a given operating system version.
member.remarks: Primarily used by OS bindings to indicate APIs that should not be used anymore.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.SupportedOSPlatformGuardAttribute
member.summary: Annotates a custom guard field, property or method with a supported platform name and optional version. Multiple attributes can be applied to indicate guard for multiple supported platforms.
member.remarks:
Callers can apply a to a field, property or method and use that field, property or method in a conditional or assert statements in order to safely call platform specific APIs.
The type of the field or property should be boolean, the method return type should be boolean in order to be used as platform guard.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Versioning.UnsupportedOSPlatformGuardAttribute
member.summary: Annotates the custom guard field, property or method with an unsupported platform name and optional version. Multiple attributes can be applied to indicate guard for multiple unsupported platforms.
member.remarks:
Callers can apply a to a field, property or method and use that field, property or method in a conditional or assert statements as a guard to safely call APIs unsupported on those platforms.
The type of the field or property should be boolean, the method return type should be boolean in order to be used as platform guard.
